IDelaunay2

Defines the interface used for creating Delaunay triangulations from a set of 2D points.

Functions
Open
virtual void Open() = 0

Opens the triangulation so points can be added

AddPoint
virtual void AddPoint(
Vector2 &pt,
Vector2 &uv,
bool isBoundary
) = 0

Opens the triangulation so points can be added

Parameters
pt
Vector2&

point to add to triangulation

uv
Vector2&

UV coordinates of the point

isBoundary
bool

True if point is part of the triangulation boundary

Close
virtual void Close() = 0

Closes the triangulation and performs the Delaunay triangulation on the set of points

GetNumberTriangles
virtual uint32 GetNumberTriangles() = 0

Returns the number of triangles in the triangulation

GetTriangle
virtual void GetTriangle(
uint32 index,
Vector2 &v0,
Vector2 &v1,
Vector2 &v2,
bool isExterior[3]
) = 0

Returns the Nth triangle

Parameters
index
uint32

index of triangle to be retrieved

v0
Vector2&

first point in triangle

v1
Vector2&

second point in triangle

v2
Vector2&

third point in triangle

isExterior
bool[3]

flags indicating whether the returned points are part of the triangulations boundary polygon

WritePLY
virtual void WritePLY() = 0

Helper function for writing the triangulation out as a .PLY file
